additionalTextInformation.text:
A version in the Gemäldegalerie Alte Meister, Kassel [DE_MHK_GK1137] may be a copy after this painting.

[Online database Koller Auktionen, accessed 01.10.2020](https://www.kollerauktionen.ch/de/102370-0002-1194-LUCAS-CRANACH-I-_WERKST.__-Woh-1194_485467.html?RecPos=1)

pageContext.description:
The panel shows the portrait of a woman wearing a white bonnet in three-quarter profile against a blue background. She is facing to her right with her arms loosely folded in front of her. Her dress consists of a long-sleeved green top, laced around the waist, and embellished with a triple-rowed gold border, decorative slits at the elbows and a striped bodice. A finely pleated white blouse with a diamond-shaped decorative border framing the neckline is visible  beneath. In addition the sitter is wearing a white apron over her green skirt and two necklaces complete her decorative accessories: one is more compact and made of pearls, while the other is more massive gold link chain.
[cda 2020]

pageContext.provenance:
- Galerie Reinhardt, 1929
- William Goldman collection, New York (exhibited at Diemen in 1930)
- auctioned at Sotheby's, London, 05.07.1967, lot 112 (as Lucas Cranach the Elder)
- private collection Switzerland 
- auctioned at Koller's, Switzerland, 25.09.2020, lot 3012
